Everytime I close Firefox and restart it, i get the home page and the option to restore the previous session. Moreover the option (window) to save&quit does not appear at all and the only window that get when i close firefox is the conformation box to close all tabs. I have already reinstalled the whole system (clean install) but this has not changed the way firefox closes. Hope this explains the situation.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open Firefox
2.Close Firefox
3.Reopen Firefox with message to restore previous session
Actual Results:  
It happens everytime when I open firefox

Expected Results:  
Firefox should prompt to save tabs before closing and should open without the restore option on restart.

comments.raw_text: This behavior was changed in Firefox 4. Changing "browser.showQuitWarning" to true in about:config should bring back the save and quit warning.
comments.author: dugar.siddhartha@gmail.com
comments.creator: dugar.siddhartha@gmail.com
comments.text: This behavior was changed in Firefox 4. Changing "browser.showQuitWarning" to true in about:config should bring back the save and quit warning.

comments.raw_text: As you describe it, it's normal behavior. Sessions are always saved (that's why there's no prompt anymore). That's why you always see the option on the homepage (if you're using about:home at least, otherwise in Firefox->History).
comments.creator: jo.hermans@gmail.com
